This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=COLOURSTUDIES.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T15:02:24Z Chappell, Duncan 2015-03-11T15:02:16-00:00 2015-03-11T15:02:16-00:00 Tweet from MuseumNaturalHistory (@morethanadodo) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;b564d806.1503 MuseumNaturalHistory (@morethanadodo)<br>11/03/2015 11:00<br>Changing Crystals - Chameleon colours 'switched by crystals' bbc.in/1E4Tnxk pic.twitter.com/wNHpkbxf4m<br><br>Download the official Twitter app here<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art<br>164 Renfrew Street<br>Glasgow G3 6RF Chappell, Duncan 2015-02-25T14:03:17-00:00 2015-02-25T14:03:17-00:00 Tweet from Present and Correct (@presentcorrect) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;6cb63bec.1502 Present and Correct (@presentcorrect)<br>25/02/2015 12:31<br>Chris Mullen's Collection of Books on Colour.<br>fulltable.com/VTS/c/cbk/me.h\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd pic.twitter.com/18hcMdDyuV<br><br>Download the official Twitter app here<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art<br>164 Renfrew Street<br>Glasgow G3 6RF Carole Biggam 2015-02-24T16:33:15-00:00 2015-02-24T16:33:15-00:00 Colour Studies Group meeting notes https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;b64cd9b7.1502 Dear All,<br><br>Here are the notes from our last meeting, with many thanks to our speaker,<br>Duncan Chappell.<br><br>GLASGOW COLOUR STUDIES GROUP<br><br>Notes following the Twenty-Fifth Meeting, 18th February 2015<br><br>The twenty-fifth meeting of the GCSG took place in Room 1, English Language,<br>University of Glasgow. Thanks are due to Carole Biggam who organized the<br>meeting and introduced the speaker, to Christian Kay who designed the<br>poster, and to Christian Kay and Carole Hough who organized the<br>refreshments. [...] Carole Biggam 2015-02-16T10:15:27-00:00 2015-02-16T10:15:27-00:00 Glasgow Colour Studies Group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;eabb0bf7.1502 GLASGOW COLOUR STUDIES GROUP<br><br>Wednesday, 18th February, 2015<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br><br>Academic Liaison Librarian, Glasgow School of Art<br><br>Lost and Found: Colour Resources at the Glasgow School of Art<br><br>English Language<br><br>12 University Gardens, Room 1 (Ground Floor)<br><br>Doors open (and free refreshments) 4.45 p.m.<br><br>Talk begins at 5.10 p.m.<br><br>On 23 May 2014 the Mackintosh Building at the Glasgow School of Art was<br>devastated by fire. This disaster destroyed the School's world-famous<br>Mackintosh Library and its historical collections, along with many objects<br>from its museum collections. The School's archives, though saved, were<br>damaged by smoke and water. This talk will [...] Carole Biggam 2015-02-11T15:59:17-00:00 2015-02-11T15:59:17-00:00 Glasgow Colour Studies Group meeting https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;6e82dace.1502 Dear GCSG members,<br><br>This is to remind you that Duncan Chappell, Academic Liaison Librarian at<br>Glasgow School of Art, will be speaking on Wednesday 18th February on Lost<br>and Found: Colour Resources at the Glasgow School of Art (see below for a<br>synopsis).<br><br>As usual the talk will take place in Room 1 (the front room) at 12<br>University Gardens. Free refreshments will be available in the foyer from<br>4.45 p.m. and the talk will begin at about 5.10 p.m. [...] Chappell, Duncan 2015-02-05T09:30:33-00:00 2015-02-05T09:30:33-00:00 Tweet from New Scientist (@newscientist) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;36f7f324.1502 New Scientist (@newscientist)<br>04/02/2015 17:21<br>Lilac and turquoise should count as basic colours - just like red, green and blue ow.ly/IuGWj pic.twitter.com/1oKXGNkDmz<br><br>Download the official Twitter app here<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art<br>164 Renfrew Street<br>Glasgow G3 6RF Carole Biggam 2014-12-01T22:10:37-00:00 2014-12-01T22:10:37-00:00 Purple parchment https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;254e11d3.1412 Please see the attachment about a talk on purple parchment to be held in<br>Edinburgh on Wednesday 3rd December. Heather Pulliam apologises for the<br>short notice.<br><br>Best regards,<br><br>Carole B Carole Biggam 2014-11-29T12:18:45-00:00 2014-11-29T12:18:45-00:00 New colour book https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;9492a3b4.1411 The publisher John Benjamins has just announced the publication of 'Colour<br>Studies: A Broad Spectrum' edited by Wendy Anderson, Carole P. Biggam,<br>Carole Hough and Christian Kay. It includes a number of articles based on<br>papers read at the 'Progress in Colour Studies' conference, held in the<br>University of Glasgow in 2012. The book starts with the keynote article on<br>prehistoric colour semantics (C. P. Biggam), and this is followed by<br>articles in the sections: Colour and Linguistics; Colour Categorization,<br>Naming and Preference; and Colour and the World. Full details can be seen<br>at: https://benjamins.com/#catalog/books/z.191/toc An ideal Christmas<br>present! [...] Carole Biggam 2014-11-10T20:22:58-00:00 2014-11-10T20:22:58-00:00 Colour Studies Group reminder https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;700f1e5a.1411 GLASGOW COLOUR STUDIES GROUP<br><br>Wednesday, 19th November, 2014<br><br>Dr Richard Jones<br><br>Archaeological chemist, University of Glasgow<br><br>Recent Work on Minoan and Mycenaean Wall Paintings<br><br>English Language<br><br>12 University Gardens, Room 1 (Ground Floor)<br><br>Doors open (and free refreshments) 4.45 p.m.<br><br>Talk begins at 5.10 p.m.<br><br>Minoan and Mycenaean wall paintings continue to attract great attention<br>through new discoveries such as those at Tell el Dabca in the Nile delta as<br>well as at Pylos and Iklaina in the Peloponnese. New research is<br>increasingly integrating the paintings' art historical and technical aspects<br>to give a more rounded view of the painter's [...] Chappell, Duncan 2014-10-28T17:52:25-00:00 2014-10-28T17:52:25-00:00 New Colour Resource https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;86a1ae80.1410 Dear All<br><br>NPR has just released this new resource on colour which many of you will<br>be interested in. http://apps.npr.org/lookatthis/posts/colors/<br><br>Very best wishes<br><br>Duncan Chappell MSc. MCLIP AFHEA<br><br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br><br>Glasgow School of Art<br><br>164 Renfrew Street<br><br>Glasgow G3 6RF<br><br>E: d.chappell@gsa.ac.uk<br><br>L: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/duncan-chappell/61/180/412<br><br>T: @DuncanChappell Chappell, Duncan 2014-10-10T13:18:15+01:00 2014-10-10T13:18:15+01:00 Shades of Grey: Painting Without Colour https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;19224ab9.1410 Dear All<br><br>Next year's Association of Art Historians conference 'Shades of Grey: Painting Without Colour' might be of interest. Proposals for papers are also being sought<br><br>http://www.aah.org.uk/annual-conference/sessions2015/session25<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art Carole Biggam 2014-10-08T10:05:56+01:00 2014-10-08T10:05:56+01:00 Colour Studies Group programme 2014-15 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;9d6454a2.1410 Dear All,<br><br>Please note our programme below for the new academic year. If you can,<br>please also display the attached poster. The committee looks forward to<br>seeing many of you again at these meetings, and please feel free to bring<br>along friends and colleagues too.<br><br>GLASGOW COLOUR STUDIES GROUP<br><br>Programme for 2014-2015<br><br>Dr Richard Jones, Archaeological chemist, University of Glasgow. [...] Chappell, Duncan 2014-10-03T19:45:42+01:00 2014-10-03T19:45:42+01:00 The Colour Reference Library, Royal College of Art, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;661f509a.1410 Hi All<br><br>The latest issue of the Journal of Design History includes a paper on the Colour Reference Library at the RCA<br><br>jdh.oxfordjournals.org/content/27/3/297.abstract.html?etoc<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art Carole Biggam 2014-07-31T21:17:25+01:00 2014-07-31T21:17:25+01:00 New colour book https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;3a15b9bb.1407 Dear All,<br><br>I've just come across a book published last year:<br><br>Color-terms in social and cultural context in Ancient Rome, by Rachael B.<br>Goldman.<br><br>Gorgias Studies in Classical and Late Antiquity vol. 3.<br><br>Publisher: Gorgias Press (Piscataway, NJ, USA), 2013.<br><br>ISBN: 978-1-61143-914-4<br><br>The book is based on part of Goldman's doctoral thesis.<br><br>All the best,<br><br>Carole B Carole Biggam 2014-07-17T10:30:33+01:00 2014-07-17T10:30:33+01:00 Colour studies in Bulgaria https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;d0d96824.1407 Prof. Mony Almalech has contacted our group in connection with the World<br>Congress of Semiotics to be held in Sofia, Bulgaria in September of this<br>year. He plans to hold a round table on the semiotics of colour, and invites<br>proposals from us. See <http://semio2014.org/en/semiotics-of-color><br>http://semio2014.org/en/semiotics-of-color He tells me that proposals can<br>be evaluated up to 15th August, and he apologizes for the short notice but<br>he's only just discovered us. [...] Dr. Denise Reitzenstein 2014-07-14T17:20:35+02:00 2014-07-14T17:20:35+02:00 CONF, MUNICH: 4./5.9.2014 "Farb-Ordnungen" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;a239e155.1407 Dear all,<br><br>the Munich Center for Ancient Worlds organizes an international and<br>interdisciplinary meeting on "Colour orders. Basic colours in ancient<br>cultures and their reception". For those, who are interested and around<br>by any chance, it will take place on 4./5.9.2014 at Institut f\ufffd\ufffdr<br>Klassische Arch\ufffd\ufffdologie, Katharina-von-Bora-Str. 10, Munich, Germany, and<br>questions orders and meaning of basic colours in Antiquity from textual<br>and material point of view. Here, you will find details on the program:<br>http://www.mzaw.uni-muenchen.de/veranstaltungen/farben_programm.pdf [...] Chappell, Duncan 2014-06-25T12:20:55+01:00 2014-06-25T12:20:55+01:00 19c Colour Dictionaries https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;d199a54d.1406 Hi All<br><br>The Smithsonian Magazine has an article on 19th c colour dictionaries this month<br><br>http://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/how-red-dragons-blood-180951822/<br><br>Duncan Chappell MSc. MCLIP AFHEA<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art<br>164 Renfrew Street<br>Glasgow G3 6RF<br>E: d.chappell@gsa.ac.uk<br>L: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/duncan-chappell/61/180/412<br>T: @DuncanChappell Margaret MacDonald 2014-06-25T10:35:43+00:00 2014-06-25T10:35:43+00:00 FW: GSA Library Wants List https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;2059b0b9.1406 I am forwarding the GSA Library wants list, because as you will see priorities for student research include a book on Corbusier's colour and 'Colour magazine'. If anyone can help, please do!<br>Best wishes, Margaret<br><br>From: Glasgow Colour Studies group [mailto:COLOURSTUDIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Chappell, Duncan<br>Sent: 24 June 2014 13:45<br>To: COLOURSTUDIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: GSA Library Wants List [...] Chappell, Duncan 2014-06-24T13:44:44+01:00 2014-06-24T13:44:44+01:00 GSA Library Wants List https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;7d8ccd01.1406 Dear Colleagues<br><br>You will have seen press reports of the fire that destroyed our<br>Mackintosh Library, often voted one of the most beautiful library spaces<br>in the world. We've issued a statement here<br>http://gsalibrarytreasures.wordpress.com/2014/05/30/statement-on-the-mac<br>kintosh-library-collections/<br><br>The entire library and its contents were destroyed, but we have been<br>humbled by the many good wishes and kind words we have received across<br>the world from friends and strangers alike. [...] Chappell, Duncan 2014-06-23T22:16:42+01:00 2014-06-23T22:16:42+01:00 <No subject> https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;bc49c8f4.1406 An interesting artist-led initiative http://www.colourstoryapp.com/<br><br>Duncan Chappell<br>Academic Liaison Librarian<br>Glasgow School of Art David Simmons 2014-06-23T10:14:43+01:00 2014-06-23T10:14:43+01:00 Fwd: Hunterian Insight Talk - Tuesday 24 June 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;cdc72169.1406 Hi folks,<br><br>This looks like a good one for us ....<br><br>Best ... David<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>> From: Harriet Gaston <Harriet.Gaston@glasgow.ac.uk><br>> Date: 23 June 2014 09:56:02 BST<br>> To: 'Publicitynet' <publicitynet@gla.ac.uk><br>> Cc: HM Everyone <HMEveryone@campus.gla.ac.uk><br>> Subject: Hunterian Insight Talk - Tuesday 24 June 2014<br>><br>> This week’s Hunterian Insight Talk is:<br>><br>> Turkey Red: Glasgow’s Colourful Textile History<br>> Date: Tuesday 24 June 2014<br>> Time: 1.00pm - 1.15pm<br>> Speaker: Julie Wertz, Hunterian Associate<br>> Location: Hunterian Museum<br>><br>> Future talks can be found on our website at: http://www.gla.ac.uk/hunterian/visit/insighttalks/<br>><br>> Harriet [...] David Simmons 2014-06-16T16:05:32+01:00 2014-06-16T16:05:32+01:00 Fwd: [Idi-seminars] FW: [GIST] Talk this week: Dr David Flatla https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COLOURSTUDIES;728927f7.1406 Hello,<br><br>this talk tomorrow may be of interest to Colour Studies group members.<br>The location is School of Computing Science building (Sir Alwyn<br>Williams) on Lilybank Gardens.<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>> From: Roderick Murray-Smith <Roderick.Murray-Smith@glasgow.ac.uk><br>> Date: 16 June 2014 15:37:52 BST<br>><br>><br>> The GIST talk this week is from Dr David Flatla, from the University<br>> of Dundee.<br>><br>> When: Tuesday 17th June @ 15:00-16:00<br>> Where: Sir Alwyn Williams Building 422<br>> Who: Dr David Flatla, University of Dundee<br>><br>> Title: Do You See What I See? Modelling Differences in Colour<br>> Perception<br>> [...]
